para.text: This function aim to check the tripping frequency value of under-frequency protection.

In the Under-frequency test, the start frequency is required to be greater than the action frequency of the protection setting. If the protection relay with the "start frequency" requirement, it should also be greater than the "start frequency" of the protection. Usually "start frequency" we set as nominal frequency, "stop frequency" set as less than the action frequency of the protection relay to ensure the protection relay can met the trip conditions.

para.text: Defined all the analog outputs magnitudes and phase angles. make the protection relay work properly.

para.text: Duration of prefault state, using the output config with start frequency value.

para.text: Maximum time of fault state automatically calculated by module.

para.text: An stable state after the variable slipped if no tripping met.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Defined the initial frequency on each steps start. Usually is set to Fnom.
Defined the ramping step frequency value from start frequency to destination frequency. Reduce this value can increase the accuracy of test result.
Defined the destination frequency value; Usually this value should ensure the protection relay can trip.
Note: Normally this value should greater than 45Hz, it may make the protection relay latched and effective test result.
Defined the slip from start frequency to currently stop frequency. Usually this value should less than the df/dt latch value of protection relay.
